description: Lockwell's AI-managed, all-in-one Security Operations (SecOps) Platform is the easiest and most affordable way to secure your organization, gain compliance, and drive revenue. Our customers go from zero to NIST Compliant in 7 days at 1/10th the cost and 20x faster than comparable solutions.
problem_statement: Basic cyber defenses are inaccessible to the vast majority of small businesses. We help any-sized organization access the security they need to stay safe in a world where cyber threats are growing exponentially.

market_opportunity.justification:
Target customer: 10-100 Team SMBs using Google Workspace or Microsoft 365. Their most significant pain point is insufficient internal knowledge or time to secure themselves from existential cyber threats. They have no idea where to start. Their second pain point is limited budgets.
Market size: SAM = 50B, TAM = 250B (entire cybersecurity market in 2025)

product_differentiation.justification:
Competitors: Our Main Competitor is the MSSP (Managed Security Service Providers) industry. They are servicing mid-size to larger enterprises, combining disparate tech solutions into a costly outsourced service model that is expert-heavy and gate-keeps from internal IT teams. AI Agent models are the future of cybersecurity.
In-market since: AI SaaS. We've been in market in Beta for about 1 year (MVP). About 1 month with our completed AI-Managed SecOps Platform.

go_to_market_traction.justification:
Traction: - 200K ARR added, 50+ logos, 400+ Seats Added. First AEs hired. Beginning to scale Outbound demand gen channels successfully.
- SOC 2 & other compliance. 
- Distribution partnership signed with Paychex.
- Major Product releases: Elle, Cyber Defense Agent; Instant NIST compliance for our customers.
Customers: Please see deck
Pricing: 75+ Paying Logos - 4.2K ACV. Per seat pricing.

ecosystem_signals.justification:
Program source: Referral
Referral: Allison Baum Gates

founder_team_strength.justification:
Co-founders: Emerson Ravyn, CEO - www.linkedin.com/in/emerson-ravyn
Ryan Margono, CTO - https://www.linkedin.com/in/ryan-margono/
Grant Anderson, Head of Design - https://www.linkedin.com/in/granteanderson/

strategic_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s thesis around digital transformation and workforce innovation.

red_flags: It depends on the definition of success. Suppose the rapid expansion and inevitable rise of AI-managed security Operations define success. In that case, funding is the most significant barrier, as it would support current growth and R&D trajectory. The infinite cyber war rages on with so many unprotected.
We have gaps in network connections to large value-added distribution networks, and we can always use more support with fundraising and mid/later-stage operational scaling.

founder_profile.name: [Emerson Ravyn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ryan-margono/)
highlights: Founder has demonstrated commitment to solving a real market pain, often with personal or domain-driven insight.
Team typically includes technical or domain-specific expertise relevant to their solution.
Backgrounds show a mix of startup, academic, or operator experience that informs their execution approach.

founder_impact_assessment:
One significant feedback (we heard this multiple times) when we first entered the market last summer was that although customers were happy to be secure with all the tools we offered, they felt like they were missing the proof that any of it worked. We started churning all the free pilots we had set up during the development phases, as potential customers didn't know if it solved their security worries. 

We realized then that customers were seeking to build trust internally and externally and prove to themselves and the world they were secure. We pivoted to vertically integrating the NIST framework and automated policy and audit creation into onboarding. We saw immediate gains in every part of the funnel and realized we were solving their problem, linking security to their revenue, which was much more complex than simple tooling.

sector_fit.justification: Aligned with SV’s macro thesis on workforce transformation, digital enablement, and operational efficiency.

employer_ecosystem_leverage.justification: Could integrate into SV portfolio employer use cases or distribution channels—especially those focused on talent, productivity, or care delivery.

gtm_support_potential.justification: Making deeper connections with possible distribution partners and deepening our relationship with the SemperVirens ecosystem.

strategic_partner_amplification.justification: Potential partnerships with other SV-backed platforms and vendors targeting the same buyer.

acceleration_readiness.justification: Product and team are early but show clear focus, alignment, and testable GTM hypotheses. Well-positioned for structured SV support.

successes_and_areas_of_investigation.description: It depends on the definition of success. Suppose the rapid expansion and inevitable rise of AI-managed security Operations define success. In that case, funding is the most significant barrier, as it would support current growth and R&D trajectory. The infinite cyber war rages on with so many unprotected.
We have gaps in network connections to large value-added distribution networks, and we can always use more support with fundraising and mid/later-stage operational scaling.

category_comparison: Lockwell Inc positions itself against legacy and niche solutions. Its competitive advantage is built on integration, UX, and customer-centric outcomes.

primary_competitors.name: Incumbent Providers
primary_competitors.description: Traditional solutions or services that lack personalization, automation, or modern UX.
primary_competitors.comparison: This company differentiates via digital-first, user-centric, or AI-driven design. This competitor often lacks the depth or product flexibility needed to address evolving employer or operational requirements.

primary_competitors.name: Point Solutions
primary_competitors.description: Niche vendors addressing one aspect of the problem.
primary_competitors.comparison: This company offers a more integrated or holistic experience. This competitor often lacks the depth or product flexibility needed to address evolving employer or operational requirements.

category_comparison_expanded.conclusion: Lockwell Inc is positioned well in its category with a differentiated product. With further traction and partnerships, it could emerge as a category leader.

final_recommendation.rationale: Pending deeper review, financial validation, and external signal confirmation.
